User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0 Build ID: 20111104165243 Steps to reproduce: open a html file on MAC OS X with windows format page relative URLs page has URLs formatted for Windows as: 2.66 ddlInvertIndex() - convert an index back into table form
These URLs work when accessing the html file remotely on a windows share but the URLs fail when accessing the html file on a local disk. Actual results: clicking on the link [source listed above] when the html file is on a local MAC OS disk results in an invalid relative URL: Local html file: "file:///Volumes/Raid Set 3/whamtech documentation/product documentation/thunderbolt/docs/engine4.htm" resolved relative URL: "file:///Volumes/Raid Set 3/whamtech documentation/product documentation/thunderbolt/docs/.\html\InvertIndexAPI.htm" clicking on the same link on the same html file when the file is on a Windows OS share results in a valid URL remote html file on a windows share: "file:///Volumes/Shared/Development/Product Documentation/Thunderbolt/Docs/Engine4.htm" resolved relative URL: "file:///Volumes/Shared/Development/Product Documentation/Thunderbolt/Docs/html/invertindexapi.htm" Expected results: Firefox's URL composting should treat "/" and "\" as interchangeable and should collapse "/.\" to "/"
